value: - A old timber-house dating back to the 16th century. The soon-to-be Swedish king Gustaf Vasa hid here after the Stockholm Bloodbath, when he was the last remain of the Swedish noble the Danes sought to eliminate. Guided tours are available.
. Modern ski-facility some kilometres from Borlänge downtown.
content=The largest shopping-mall in the province with over 80 shops and resturants.
content=Borlänge city, as the biggest city in the province it offers about 70 shops, over 30 resturants with food from 8 cultures and about 10 coffeeshops.
content=Possibly the best in town, located smack in the middle of the Borlänge very close to the tourist information office.
content=Weird interiors but great Indian food.
content=Not just takeaway, despite the name. American style pizzas, don't miss the mouth-watering El Taco with guacamole and sour cream!

, above Stationsgatan 1, is the place for people in the ages 25-30+ while

value: , the white-collar sibling and friendly rival of Borlänge, has a UNESCO-listed old copper mine and is just 20 minutes away by car.
, the area around beautiful Lake Siljan, is a very attractive part of Dalarna and well worth a visit.
